verses.verse: (Practical Admonitions) (Prov 11.15; 17.18; 20.16; 22.26; 27.13) My child, if you have given your pledge to your neighbor, if you have bound yourself to another, (Or a stranger)
you are snared by the utterance of your lips, (Cn Compare Gk Syr: Heb the words of your mouth) caught by the words of your mouth.
So do this, my child, and save yourself, for you have come into your neighbor’s power: go, hurry, (Or humble yourself) and plead with your neighbor.
(Ps 132.4) Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber;
(Ps 91.3) save yourself like a gazelle from the hunter, (Cn: Heb from the hand) like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
(Prov 30.24, 25) Go to the ant, you lazybones; consider its ways and be wise.
Without having any chief or officer or ruler,
(Prov 10.5) it prepares its food in summer and gathers its sustenance in harvest.
(Prov 24.33) How long will you lie there, O lazybones? When will you rise from your sleep?
A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,
(Prov 10.4; 13.4; 20.4) and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want, like an armed warrior.
(Prov 10.32; 16.27) A scoundrel and a villain goes around with crooked speech,
(Ps 35.19; Prov 10.10) winking the eyes, shuffling the feet, pointing the fingers,
(Mic 2.1) with perverted mind devising evil, continually sowing discord;
(Prov 24.22; Jer 19.11) on such a one calamity will descend suddenly, in a moment, damage beyond repair.
There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are an abomination to him:
(Ps 18.27; 120.2; Isa 1.15) haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
(Gen 6.5; Prov 1.16) a heart that devises wicked plans, feet that hurry to run to evil,
(Ps 27.12) a lying witness who testifies falsely, and one who sows discord in a family.
(Prov 1.8; 7.1) My child, keep your father’s commandment, and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
(Prov 3.3) Bind them upon your heart always; tie them around your neck.
(Prov 3.23, 24) When you walk, they (Heb it) will lead you; when you lie down, they (Heb it) will watch over you; and when you awake, they (Heb it) will talk with you.
(Ps 19.8) For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light, and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,
(Prov 2.16; 5.3) to preserve you from the wife of another, (Gk: MT the evil woman) from the smooth tongue of the adulteress. (Heb alien woman)
(Mt 5.28) Do not desire her beauty in your heart, and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes,

(Prov 7.23; 29.3; Ezek 13.18) for a prostitute’s fee is only a loaf of bread, (Cn Compare Gk Syr Vg Tg: Heb for because of a harlot to a piece of bread) but the wife of another stalks a man’s precious life.
Can fire be carried in the bosom without burning one’s clothes?
Or can one walk on hot coals without scorching the feet?
(Ezek 18.6; 33.26) So is he who sleeps with his neighbor’s wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.
Thieves are not despised who steal only to satisfy their appetite when they are hungry.
(Ex 22.1-4) Yet if they are caught, they will pay sevenfold; they will forfeit all the goods of their house.
(Prov 7.7) But he who commits adultery has no sense; he who does it destroys himself.
He will get wounds and dishonor, and his disgrace will not be wiped away.
(Prov 11.4; 27.4) For jealousy arouses a husband’s fury, and he will show no restraint when he takes revenge.
He will accept no compensation and will refuse a bribe no matter how great.
